Title: SOP Manual Index & Version Control
Cross-References: FFR SOP-0001, FFR SOP-0013, FFR SOP-1035, FFR SOP-1036, FFR SOP-6035
Content (14-Block Text):
FFR SOP-0000: SOP Manual Index & Version Control
Version: 2025.08 | Effective Date: August 1, 2025
Prepared By: Winston Johnson, COO | Approved By: David Johnson, CEO
Florida First Roofing LLC | 3815 N. Cocoa Blvd #13, Cocoa, FL 32926 | Ph: 321-301-4512 | www.floridafirstroofing.com | FL State Certified Roofing Contractor – LIC# CCC1336561
⸻
1. PURPOSE
Establish standardized procedures for sop manual index & version control tailored to Florida First Roofing LLC operations, ensuring compliance with the Florida Building Code (FBC), OSHA construction standards, and applicable Florida and federal law.
⸻
2. SCOPE
Applies to FFR employees, subcontractors, and vendors engaged in activities governed by this SOP across residential and commercial projects in Florida.
⸻
3. DEFINITIONS
- FBC: Florida Building Code
- OSHA: Occupational Safety and Health Administration (29 CFR 1926)
- DMS: Document Management System
⸻
4. PROCEDURES
- Execute sop manual index & version control in accordance with project plans, manufacturer specifications, and safety protocols.
- Document approvals, inspections, and field checks in the PM system.
- Manage deviations via the Change Request workflow (FFR SOP-0013).
⸻
5. RESPONSIBILITIES
- Owner Department (COO): Maintain this SOP and ensure implementation.
- Project Manager: Plan, coordinate, and verify compliance.
- Safety Officer: Enforce OSHA/FBC requirements on site.
⸻
6. REFERENCES
- https://codes.iccsafe.org/content/FLBC2023P1/chapter-15-roof-assemblies-and-rooftop-structures
- https://www.leg.state.fl.us/statutes/index.cfm?App_mode=Display_Statute&URL=0500-0599/0553/0553.html
- https://www.leg.state.fl.us/statutes/index.cfm?App_mode=Display_Statute&URL=0400-0499/0489/0489ContentsIndex.html
- https://www.osha.gov/laws-regs/regulations/standardnumber/1926/1926.501
⸻
7. RECORDS
- Checklists, permits, logs, inspection forms, training records retained per FFR SOP-6035.
⸻
8. TRAINING
- Role-based training in LMS; refresh annually or on regulation change.
⸻
9. REVIEW
- Reviewed annually and upon process or regulatory change.
⸻
10. APPENDICES
- Appendix A: Forms & checklists
- Appendix B: Job aids
⸻
11. APPROVALS
- COO: __________________  Date: __________
- CEO: __________________  Date: __________
⸻
12. METADATA TAGS
#SOP_14BLOCK_MANDATE #FFR_STANDARD
⸻
13. SYSTEM INTEGRATION
- CRM/LMS/DMS metadata applied; retention per FFR SOP-6035.
⸻
14. DOCUMENT FOOTER
Document Code: SOP-0000_2025.08 | Classification: Proprietary – Internal Use Only
Cross-References: FFR SOP-0001, FFR SOP-0013, FFR SOP-1035, FFR SOP-1036, FFR SOP-6035

Prepared By: Winston Johnson, COO | Approved By: David Johnson, CEO
Florida First Roofing LLC | 3815 N. Cocoa Blvd #13, Cocoa, FL 32926 | Ph: 321-301-4512 | www.floridafirstroofing.com | FL State Certified Roofing Contractor – LIC# CCC1336561
⸻
1. PURPOSE
Establish standardized procedures for florida roofing regulation updates tailored to Florida First Roofing LLC operations, ensuring compliance with the Florida Building Code (FBC), OSHA construction standards, and applicable Florida and federal law.
⸻
2. SCOPE
Applies to FFR employees, subcontractors, and vendors engaged in activities governed by this SOP across residential and commercial projects in Florida.
⸻
3. DEFINITIONS
- FBC: Florida Building Code
- OSHA: Occupational Safety and Health Administration (29 CFR 1926)
- DMS: Document Management System
⸻
4. PROCEDURES
- Execute florida roofing regulation updates in accordance with project plans, manufacturer specifications, and safety protocols.
- Document approvals, inspections, and field checks in the PM system.
- Manage deviations via the Change Request workflow (FFR SOP-0013).
⸻
5. RESPONSIBILITIES
- Owner Department (COO): Maintain this SOP and ensure implementation.
- Project Manager: Plan, coordinate, and verify compliance.
- Safety Officer: Enforce OSHA/FBC requirements on site.
⸻
6. REFERENCES
- https://codes.iccsafe.org/content/FLBC2023P1/chapter-15-roof-assemblies-and-rooftop-structures
- https://www.leg.state.fl.us/statutes/index.cfm?App_mode=Display_Statute&URL=0500-0599/0553/0553.html
- https://www.leg.state.fl.us/statutes/index.cfm?App_mode=Display_Statute&URL=0400-0499/0489/0489ContentsIndex.html
- https://www.osha.gov/laws-regs/regulations/standardnumber/1926/1926.501
⸻
7. RECORDS
- Checklists, permits, logs, inspection forms, training records retained per FFR SOP-6035.
⸻
8. TRAINING
- Role-based training in LMS; refresh annually or on regulation change.
⸻
9. REVIEW
- Reviewed annually and upon process or regulatory change.
⸻
10. APPENDICES
- Appendix A: Forms & checklists
- Appendix B: Job aids
⸻
11. APPROVALS
- COO: __________________  Date: __________
- CEO: __________________  Date: __________
⸻
12. METADATA TAGS
#SOP_14BLOCK_MANDATE #FFR_STANDARD
⸻
13. SYSTEM INTEGRATION
- CRM/LMS/DMS metadata applied; retention per FFR SOP-6035.
⸻
14. DOCUMENT FOOTER

5. RESPONSIBILITIES

- Project Manager: Plan, coordinate, and verify compliance.
- Safety Officer: Enforce OSHA/FBC requirements on site.

Title: Condominium & HOA Projects
Cross-References: FFR SOP-0001, FFR SOP-0013, FFR SOP-1035, FFR SOP-1036, FFR SOP-6035
Content (14-Block Text):
FFR SOP-9059: Condominium & HOA Projects
Version: 2025.08 | Effective Date: August 1, 2025
Prepared By: Winston Johnson, COO | Approved By: David Johnson, CEO
Florida First Roofing LLC | 3815 N. Cocoa Blvd #13, Cocoa, FL 32926 | Ph: 321-301-4512 | www.floridafirstroofing.com | FL State Certified Roofing Contractor – LIC# CCC1336561
⸻
1. PURPOSE
Establish standardized procedures for condominium & hoa projects tailored to Florida First Roofing LLC operations, ensuring compliance with the Florida Building Code (FBC), OSHA construction standards, and applicable Florida and federal law.
⸻
2. SCOPE
Applies to FFR employees, subcontractors, and vendors engaged in activities governed by this SOP across residential and commercial projects in Florida.
⸻
3. DEFINITIONS
- FBC: Florida Building Code
- OSHA: Occupational Safety and Health Administration (29 CFR 1926)
- DMS: Document Management System
⸻
4. PROCEDURES
- Execute condominium & hoa projects in accordance with project plans, manufacturer specifications, and safety protocols.
- Document approvals, inspections, and field checks in the PM system.
- Manage deviations via the Change Request workflow (FFR SOP-0013).
⸻
5. RESPONSIBILITIES
- Owner Department (COO): Maintain this SOP and ensure implementation.
- Project Manager: Plan, coordinate, and verify compliance.
- Safety Officer: Enforce OSHA/FBC requirements on site.
⸻
